text:
The helicopter carrying President Ebrahim Raisi of Iran and Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian on Sunday taking off.

# Iran Leader’s Helicopter Crashes in a Thick Fog, Starting a Huge Search

## Rescue Effort Slowed by Bad Conditions

# By FARNAZ FASSIHI

A helicopter carrying President Ebrahim Raisi of Iran and his foreign minister crashed on Sunday in the country’s mountainous northwest, according to state media, deepening the turmoil that has gripped the nation on both the international and domestic fronts in recent months.

Mr. Raisi, 63, was running from Iran’s border with Azerbaijan to inaugurate a joint air port, despite the helicopter carrying Mr. Raisi and Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian, state media reported, crashed near the city of Varzaghan around 1 p.m. local time, in bad weather and thick fog.

Search and rescue teams also counted an area of land saturated with dense forest through rain and fog for more than 10 hours. As of post mortem, officials called the area’s rescue helicopter the one where, despite a loss of two crew members, the aircraft crashed on the road to the city of Qazvin.

“Even with the rain, state media said in an earlier statement, the crash did not prevent the rescue of the aircraft and the crew of the rescue helicopter,” the state media said.

# Threats and Fear Are Transforming U.S. Politics

# Biden Message At Morehouse: I’m With You
